revised_title: A Study on the Response of Building Shapes to Turbulent Wind
tldr: This article discusses the overall response of six building shapes to turbulent wind, focusing on predicting extreme responses during the life of the building. It examines the dynamic and static response characteristics of various building shapes and explores the integration of meteorological factors, aerodynamic factors, and structural response characteristics in predicting the overall response of buildings to wind.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Wind Engineering
